page.title: 01REVIEW OF CUMBERNAULD
page.content: {Cumbernauld}is a{new town}designated in 1955 with a target population of 70,000.At present the population is 50,000.It is situated in{Scotland's {industrial belt}15 miles from Glasgow and 35 miles from Edinburgh. The town was built mainly to rehouse the people living in the older areas of Glasgow(70% of the present population originally come from Glasgow).The town is carefully{planned with{housing areas}arranged around the {town centre}and separate areas set aside for{industry}on the edges of the town.Each housing area has its own shop,primary school and community hall.Grass,trees etc. are planted widely to improve the appearance of the area and a network of paths and roads has been designed to keep pedestrians safe from traffic.
